intro: Erythrorhipsalis ormindoi, commonly known as the red-veined stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It features fleshy, ribbed leaves that are typically green with prominent red or purple veins, providing it with a striking visual appearance. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange, usually blooming in late spring or early summer. It is well adapted to dry conditions, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
